title: strength
comment: The quality of power and might which characterises God and his relationship to his creation. Human strength can lead to rebellion against God on account of a belief in human self-sufficiency.

children.title: strength, divine
children.comment: The strength of God is made known in creation and redemption and in his empowering of believers to live faithfully.

children.title: The revelation of the strength of God

secondaryrefs.comment: David's song of praise for deliverance

children.title: God's strength brings comfort to believers
strength, human
children.comment: All human strength derives from God. Among non-believers, strength may become a source of arrogant self-confidence, the oppression of others or rebellion against God.

primaryrefs.comment: The Gentile world relies on fallen reason rather than revelation.

children.title: The ultimate futility of human strength

seealsos.comment: Boasting betrays the source of people's confidence

children.title: The physical strength of some godly men
strength, spiritual
children.comment: In contrast to human strength, God is the source and supplier of all spiritual strength through which believers can do all that God asks.

children.title: God is the source of spiritual strength
Strength comes from the promise of his presence
Strength comes from the realisation of his grace
Strength comes through the Holy Spirit
Overcoming strength is often veiled in weakness
